name: First Hotel Malpensa

reviews.title: Perfect Airport Hotel
reviews.text: If you have an early flight out of Malpensa and you want to drop off your rental car this is the place to overnight. We stopped at the hotel to unload our car, turned in the car at the airport. Took the hotel shuttle back to the hotel and then the hotel shuttle the following morning. Saved one day rental on the car and the possible hassle turning it in the next morning.
The hotel is a bit stingey with ice. We asked for a bucket of ice for drinks in the room, they sent up a cup with 6 cubes.
reviews.title: great location for flights out of Malpensa

reviews.text: We stayed at the First Hotel before flying out of Malpensa on an early morning flight. We took the shuttle bus from Milano Centrale train station the day before our flight.(5.5 Euros ea.) Then we caught the hotel's shuttle van to the hotel from terminal 1 at the airport. It was very close to the airport but noise was not a problem. It is in an isolated neighborhood ,so don't plan on anything but staying in the hotel. The restaurant in the hotel was very adequate for dinner and there is a local restaurant next door. The room was very clean . All in all it was a good experience though not inexpensive. Relatively speaking, the location and van to the airport(be sure to make a reservation at checkin) made the cost worth it. We left before breakfast -but it is included in the price of the room. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Very decent hotel near the Malpensa Airport
location, location, location
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for one night on May 1st 2004; following an alitalia strike that stranded me at the Malpensa Airport.

After having spent over 10 hours flying from WashingtonDC to Milan and 6 hours in the airport begging for assistance, I got on a minivan and taken to this hotel to spend the night on Alitalia's expense before boarding on a next morning flight to Athens.
reviews.title: Good place to stay for an early morning flight
Convenient Airport Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed one night at the First hotel. The hotel was very convinient. Probably the best hotel in the MAlpensa Airport area. But the rooms and bathrooms are just ok and the front desk frogot to give us our wake up call! Would recomend this hotel if you have to stay near the airport.

We had an 8 a.m. flight out of Malpensa, so we skipped the madness of an early taxi and long bus ride to the airport by staying here. The hotel is around the corner from the airport, but it is very quiet. The room was great, the people very nice and the convenience a great plus. As another has written, the food is very pricey in the restaurant, but we encountered decent food with a very pleasant staff. So, if you are hungry and particular about your food (after three weeks on the road-we weren't), eat before you come out. Left too early to assess breakfast. You can relax outside or in a comfortable lobby using the lobby bar. I would recommend staying here if you arrive by plane later in the evening before going onto Milan or your next destination. Have some Euro coins in your pocket when you arrive at Malpensa. You will need them to call the hotel for your ride. We will use this hotel again if the need arises.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice for convenience to the airport!

reviews.text: This hotel is great for spending the night before a morning flight the next day from Milan Malpensa.
reviews.title: adequate and useful but don't eat in the restaurant
Last night in europe
reviews.text: I liked the hotel's cuisine; I had dinner there. I ordered an italian lamb based dish with a herbal salad. It costed me 30 euro, out of which 20 euro were covered by alitalia. The breakfast next morning was excellent. Very good buffet selection and buffalo milk available. Quite good actually.

reviews.title: Convenience is its asset
reviews.text: The only reason to stay here is its proximity to the airport if you have an early flight the next day. For us that was reason enough. Other than that, the review of May 7, 2004 from a Seattle traveller sums it up.

Hotel first is a great place to stay when you are catching an early flight. It is very close to the airport. The front desk was helpful in giving info. re: car rental return. They also have a nice shuttle service to and from the airport. The staff was friendly and accomodating. The room was clean...just do not expect anything fancy. Very plain. The breakfast was nice. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Clean and close to Airport

reviews.text: We booked a room at the First Hotel, Malpensa Airport, Milan for the night of the 18th of July, 2005. We learned early in the morning on the 18th that Alitalia had gone on strike and we would be unable to reach Milan. We called First Hotel right away, and cancelled the reservation - and then, at the hotel's request, emailed them. The hotel emailed back a cancellation. Our American Express was charged anyway - and we were told by American Express, who investigated the situation, that this hotel has a 24-hour cancellation policy. We then filed a written documented request for reimbursement with Alitalia, and have never heard back, despite repeated phone calls, and one visit on a subsequent trip to Milan. We are out 125 Euros. It is not unusual for Alitalia to go on strike, and if you book this airport hotel, you are taking a big gamble.
reviews.title: BEWARE - if your flight is cancelled, YOU WILL PAY at this airport hotel!!

likes.liked: — This airport hotel will charge you whether you can get there or not!!
likes.disliked: — Find another airport hotel that will not take your money - if you can't get there!!
